intro: Senecio neaei var. incisus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet ray florets and yellow disk flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance.
